CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, pg. 5, reads: "Carver Day Proclamation - Seen at the ceremony where mayor David L. Lawrence (right, seated), officially proclaimed Jan. 5 as George Washington Carver Day are (seated, left to right), Mrs. Alma Illery and Edward Smith. (Standing: Mrs. Rose L. Smith, Fifth Ave. High School principal, mother of Edward; Mrs. Elaine Gibson, Mrs. W. C. Eichenlaub and Mrs. W. J. Moncrief, all of the National Achievement Clubs (NAC) of which Mrs. Illery is president and founder. The NAC annually sponsors Carver Day. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated left to right: president and founder of the National Achievement Club Alma Illery, Edward Smith, and Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence signing a proclaimation declaring January 5 as George Washington Carver Day, and standing: Fifth Avenue High School principal Rose L. Smith, mother of Edward Elaine Gibson, Mrs. W. C. Eichenlaub, and Mrs. W. J. Moncrief, gathered in the Office of the Mayor at the City County Building
